intro: Polygonum setosulum, commonly known as the hairy knotweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Polygonaceae family. It is characterized by its upright, herbaceous stems that are often covered in fine, hairy textures. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-white in color, appearing in late summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped with a slightly toothed margin and a hairy underside. Polygonum setosulum is native to parts of Asia and is often found in moist, disturbed soils.
